headline: Chas söker utvecklare inom DevOps
description.text:
Vi söker nu fler duktiga utvecklare inom DevOps som vill arbeta med spännande uppdrag som konsult hos oss på Chas!
JOBBA MED OSS
Tycker du att det är viktigt att jobba på ett företag som har högt ställda värderingar? Ett bolag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. På Chas vill vi inte enbart satsa på att ge våra konsulter högsta möjliga kompetens och de allra bästa uppdragen. Vi vill också ge tillbaka till samhället. Vi tycker även att det är viktigt att ha kul, därför åker vi på en utlandskonferens varje år och har minst ett roligt event per månad. Alla på bolaget är välkomna! !
På Chas har vi individen i fokus och vill förverkliga konsultens potential genom att få dem att utvecklas och bredda sin kompetens. Vi arbetar med många häftiga företag inom olika branscher. Några exempel är DICE, Rovio, Spotify, H&M, SEB, Telenor och SAS. Det finns alltid något för alla. Chas driver sin egna skola där våra konsulter får gå kurser gratis. Kanske vill du som Chassare fördjupa dig i Node.Js eller lära dig Swift? Inga problem!
Chas är ett företag som verkligen satsar på CSR-arbete, vi tror på att göra mer än att bara donera pengar. Vi har hållit utvecklingskurser i socialt utsatta områden och delat ut mat till hemlösa. Vill du också vara med och påverka samhället och kanske har ett eget CSR-projekt du brinner för? Då vill vi prata mer med dig!
Tillsammans här på Chas delar vi många erfarenheter, värderingar, förmåner och intressen. Det är vi tillsammans som utgör Chas och att vara en Chassare innebär att du blir en del av vår familj!
OM JOBBET
Vi söker dig som jobbat med DevOps i minst 2 år och har goda kunskaper inom backend-språk som: Python, Node.js, SQL och Java, samt att du suttit i Azure. Det är meriterande om du tidigare arbetat med AWS.
Självklart är du en lagspelare som lätt arbetar i team eller på egen hand om så krävs.
OM OSS
Chas har utsetts till Europas bästa arbetsgivare av European Business Awards som arrangerar Europas största företagstävling. Bland annat för vårt demokratiska arbetssätt med möjlighet till inflytande för medarbetarna samt vårt sätt att arbeta med förmåner och personlig karriärutveckling. Resultatet är att vi bedriver ett omfattande CSR-arbete, har startat upp en YH-skola som utbildar nya fullstack-utvecklare och har ett produktbolag.


Som anställd på Chas erbjuder vi dig möjlighet att arbeta med nya moderna tekniker hos våra kunder som är marknadsledande företag inom privat och offentlig sektor. Vi ger dig tillfälle att delta i konferenser och att utvecklas som person och som webbutvecklare. Du får också en mentor och access till vårt utbud av personalförmåner.

headline: DevOps/Cloud Engineer
description.text:
Software Skills is a recruitment company that specialises in software and IT. We match highly skilled developers, testers and other IT experts with small and large organisations, product companies and consulting companies in Gothenburg. As represented by us, you will be guided through a friendly and professional recruitment process that aims to secure a role that perfectly matches your abilities.

Our sister company Codic has grown considerably in a very short time and today encompasses more than 20 highly skilled consultants working in the fields of software engineering, application development, testing and data science at big, high tech organisations in Gothenburg.
Codic takes pride in being a niche agency that relies on competence-based recruitment and in-house IT and industry expertise. Compared to many of their competitors, they want to stay local and not outgrow the familiar atmosphere they have cultivated over the years.
Role description
You will have all the benefits of working for a small startup company eager to get together for lunches, after works and other events, while honing your skills and gaining experience at a larger organisation.
In the role, you will work in a team together with other senior cloud developers. You need to have at least three years of work experience and be proficient in the following:
DevOps

System Integration
3+ years of backend or fullstack development, preferred skills in Java and Python



As one of their consultants, you will be part of a friendly and fast-growing startup, where you are surrounded by highly talented and challenge-oriented peers from Sweden and abroad. You will be offered a competitive salary, a generous “friskvårdsbidrag” and a company bike. You will also have access to the office whenever you like, including after office hours.
Your interests and areas of expertise are considered an asset to the company; Codic is at the forefront of staff education and development and are more than happy to help you grow as a professional and individual.

Please press the Apply button at the top right corner of the page. We consider candidates on a rolling basis, which means the role might be filled before the application deadline.
GDPR: We handle your personal data according to the General Data Protection Regulation and ask you to read our Privacy Policy before signing up to our website.

headline: DevOps
description.text:
Who are we?
Volvo Cars is a company on a mission; to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable and smart future.
Since 1927, we have been a brand known for our commitment to safety, creating innovative cars that make life less complicated for our consumers. In 2010, we decided to transform our business, resulting in a totally new generation of cars and technologies, as well as steady growth and record sales. 
We are constantly pushing our own skills and abilities to drive change in the automobile industry like never before. We are looking for innovative, committed people to join us in this endeavour and create safe, sustainable and connected cars. We believe in the power of people and will challenge and support you to reach your full potential. Join us and be part of Volvo Cars’ journey into the future.

About the department - Core System Software
In our part of the R&D, we code the base software on the Core Computer to refine computational power and to enable successful integration with applications. Our teams work in an agile manner organized according to SAFe to be able to quickly adjust to changing requirements.
We work with an a-state-of-the-art embedded multiprocessor environment from Nvidia including hypervisors, Linux, QNX, Rust, Robot Framework, and other modern technologies.

Role specifics
Together with your team you will monitor the CI environment and ensure that the different build pipelines are up and running. You and the team supports the developers with debugging and analysis of problems that occur in the CI system. A good CI system and support to the development teams are key to ensure a fast and agile development environment.

Requirements
We would wish for you to have a keen interest in DevOps used in modern SW development as well as a passion for creating a stable development environment giving our developers a fast feedback loop. You like solving problems together with and through others. You have a strong customer focus, enjoy the possibility to influence and you love to be part of a team where we take our own initiatives, and take pride in your own and the team’s deliveries.
Give support to different parts of the organization such as developers, testers, and management. Interest in the automation of tasks. Competence in C++, Python, Docker, and working with cloud-based solutions are meriting.

  *  Surpassed 10.000h coding hours in professional contexts
  *  Exam from BSc or MSc in Computer Science, or BSc in Computer Science + MSc in Embedded Systems alt. BSc from Electrical Engineering + MSc in Embedded Systems


Interest and application
We are curious what you think about the future. Would you like to know more about our R&D and the role?

Please note that applications by e-mail will not be accepted due to GDPR.
As we use our own channels for recruitment, we respectfully but strictly decline to be contacted for any offer of recruitment assistance from external companies.

headline: DevOps
description.text:
#jobbjustnu
We're looking for a DevOp to join our team here in Gothenburg, Sweden.
We've moved towards being a more product-oriented company in recent times, and we're beginning to develop our DevOps team!
For some of our hardware-oriented design projects, we use Qt with QML. If you like CSS and JavaScript, this might interest you too!


Role requirements
Professional experience with Kubernetes, Docker and Terraform
Professional experience with managing CI and CD pipelines
Experience with NixOS, Concourse CI and/or GitLab is a plus but not required
Capacity to learn quickly
A desire to work with a wide array of services implemented in languages such as Rust, Kotlin or TypeScript
Cares about security and considers attack service when making decisions
Desires to work closely with development teams to deploy their services and assist with build toolchains
Some on-call responsibilities are included in this role.



Apply for the job
As a creative agency, devs are expected to work closely with the design teams, often working together as one to solve a client problem or deliver a solid product. We're adding DevOps to this mix to make our teams even stronger.
We take pride in our hiring approach, where we consider your professional and personal experience first and foremost, rather than simply looking at your formal qualifications.


About us
With our diverse team of talented designers and developers, we strive to help our clients develop innovative concepts and transform them into digital and tangible products.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Sogeti står inför en spännande utvecklingsresa och söker dig som idag jobbar med DevOps och har erfarenhet av molntjänster.

Som konsult på Sogeti ingår du i ett team som ligger kompetensmässigt i frontlinjen med fokus på att skapa mätbart affärsvärde byggt på den senaste tekniken. Dina möjligheter är oändliga då vi kan erbjuda uppdrag och steg i karriären som matchar just dina behov och önskemål. Våra kunder finns över flera branscher vilket ger dig möjligheten att arbeta med varierande uppdrag och tekniker.

Vi söker dig som idag arbetar med DevOps. Du har erfarenhet av att sätta upp miljöer enligt dessa principer. Molnet är din vän. Du trivs i din roll men vill gärna utveckla den och dig själv. Du och ditt team kommer även att ha en roll i att stötta resten av våra konsulter i Stockholm i sin kompetensutveckling samt jobba med våra lokala säljare för att ta hem fler spännande affärer inom området.

Sogeti som arbetsplats präglas av familjär känsla och positiv attityd där vi värdesätter samarbete och kul på jobbet. Vår entreprenörsanda gör oss snabbrörliga och adaptiva för svängningarna i branschen utan att förlora fokus på individen och lagandan.

Vi söker dig som värdesätter din egen utveckling högt och trivs i rollen som konsult.

Vi ser gärna att du har:

 -
Minst 2 års praktisk erfarenhet av CI/CD

 -
ARM och Terraform mallar

 -
Övervaka och testa best practices

 -
Arbetat med infra molnarkitekter för att hantera landningszoner

 -
Meriterande om du arbetat med Containers and Kubernetes


Vi erbjuder utöver härliga kollegor och en rolig samt utvecklande arbetsplats ett kompetensnätverk där din utveckling är prioriterad. Även om samarbete är kärnan i vårt sätt att arbeta ser vi även till individuella behov med ett flexibelt förmånspaket som du kan skräddarsy för att passa just dig.

Välkommen med din ansökan!

Sogeti, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, har verksamhet på över 100 orter runt om i världen. I Sverige finns 20 kontor med totalt 1200 medarbetare. Med sin pragmatiska ”value in the making”-ansats och sin passion för teknologi hjälper Sogeti organisationer att digitalisera – snabbt.

Som en global ledare inom konsult-, teknik- och ingenjörstjänster samt digital transformation ligger Capgemini-koncernen i innovationens framkant. Vi möter därmed våra kunders behov inom molntjänster, digitalisering och plattformar. Med mer än 50 års erfarenhet och en gedigen branschspecifik kompetens gör vi det möjligt för organisationer att förverkliga sina affärsmål genom ett brett spann av tjänster, från strategiarbete till drift- och förvaltningsuppdrag. Vi sätter människorna i fokus och drivs framåt av övertygelsen att med teknik realiserad affärsnytta åstadkoms av människor. 2019 omsatte Capgemini-koncernen tillsammans med förvärvet Altran 17 miljarder euro. People matter, results count.

Alla människor ska ha samma möjligheter. Inte minst i sitt arbete, därför är jämställdhet en självklarhet för oss och vi tar mängder av initiativ för att främja detta, bland annat #addher. Sveriges största nätverk för kvinnor inom IT-branschen.

headline: DevOps lead
description.text:
Join Tieto as DevOps lead consultant and help us produce world class, state of the art software solutions and services for our customers! At Tieto we believe that DevOps is important since it will help our customers to achieve and exceed profitability, market share and productivity goals. We take pride in software design, architecture and to be in the absolute frontier of software development way of working.
We offer you a challenging position with excellent development opportunities and are waiting for you to help us accelerate our growth!
With us you will be responsible for
Your mission as a DevOps lead consultant will be helping our customers to achieve their DevOps business goals. You will be working in close cooperation with the product development teams, business developers, product managers and the sales organization. You understand the different aspects of the software delivery chain and will play a key role in developing new business and professional services in this area.
We expect you to have
We believe that you hold a university degree in a relevant field, combined with several years of hands-on experience and background in DevOps, agile software development, configuration, tools, deployment and operations. 
You should have very strong automation skills (tool agnostic) and the ability to drive initiatives to automate processes. Have strong understanding of DevOps CI/CD concepts including best practices; operational experience in Linux/Unix environment and scripting languages (Shell, Perl, Python) and excellent cross-functional and interpersonal skills to work with both development and operational teams.
We also expect you to have Expert skill in one or more following tools and systems: Docker, Jenkins, Chef, Puppet, Salt, Git, MongoDB (or other NoSQL DB), Git, SVN, Jenkins, Maven, Gradle, Ansible, Puppet, Foreman, Docker, Kubernetes, Nexus, Artifactory, ELK, Dashing, Sensu, Grafana, Graphite, Nagios, Sonar, Selenium, Consul, Nginx and Varnish.
If you also have knowledge of SQL, PL/SQL, Java and/or .Net that would be an added advantage.
Thought leadership skills, team leader or architect experience is preferable as well as an interest and ability to coach and mentor others. You create solid solutions with passion and understand what it takes to work with other professionals in a team with excellence as a target. You feel comfort with collaboration, open communication and reaching out across functional borders and you have a strong drive to co-operate with customers.
As a person you are
You are the ideal candidate for this role if you are self-driven and social with high business acumen as well as being a developer/architect by heart and nature. You have a proactive way of working and have an interest in state of the art technology. You are dedicated to be a part of and contributing to building up our DevOps organization. You have the ability to work independently in a busy business environment, but likewise be a team player and easy to collaborate with. You are innovative and have the ability to understand and apply customer business logics and processes into our deliveries. You have a solution oriented mindset with a strong analytical skills. Furthermore you are a good communicator with a positive attitude and have a sense of teamwork, and are able to create strong and lasting customer relations. You also aim to exceed customer expectations.
We have an open organizational culture, encouraging people for curiosity and finding new ways of doing things. You are driven to learn new things and technologies, and often find yourself thinking outside the box. You are self-motivated and value accountability in yourself and in others. You aren’t afraid to show pride in your own achievements.
We offer
We offer you a challenging job and a motivating, international working environment with flexible hours, great benefits, and a friendly and relaxed atmosphere that fosters inspiration. Our culture is built on transparency and active sharing – a truly open environment. Moreover, we offer you opportunities to work with interesting global customers. With us, you will be at the forefront of emerging businesses and technology, exchanging ideas with the best professionals.
Join us and be part of our future success

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Our biggest strength is our culture and people. We search for our next Member, not just a resume. Therefore, we’ve put together a set of characteristics that we find most important for our team members.
1. Self-Leadership: You take the opportunity to be your own leader when the situation demands it. You take the right decisions on your own and exhibit dedication towards achieving your goals.
2. Team player: True way for a team to succeed happens through collaboration. Teams need team players who can absorb, understand, and consider ideas and points of view from other people without debating and arguing every point. You are that team player and you can receive criticism without reacting defensively.
3. Communication: Communication is very important because it's the only way we can effectively work together on anything. You can build trust, resolve problems, provide clarity and direction, create better relationships, increase engagement, improve productivity and promote team building through your communication.
4. Curiosity: You are curious about customer needs, how we can improve our services. You have desire to learn and achieve great.


If you believe it is You, great! We would like you to apply for our open position.



You will be part of a team working with modern cutting-edge technologies related to Big Data and Analytics. You will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining applications across Big Data platforms on premise and in Cloud.


Experience

Exposure to various tools and methodologies involved in Continuous Integration , Build and Deploy process
Exposure to multiple a complex dev ops environments preferably with components such as Containers , Databases , Front end Technologies

2 to 5 years' experience in any cloud/hybrid environment
1 to 2 years' experience on Infrastructure as Code tools
An Architectural perspective in Problem solving will be an added advantage



About us
Aigometri Incorporate was established in 2015 with the aim of being an innovative IT Consulting company that combines IT, Project and Test management with sales, marketing and business development to provide our customers high quality services and support.
We aim to maintain loyal and long-term relationships with the businesses that rely on us for greater efficiency, productivity and profitability.
We are engaged in development of tools and machine-learning algorithms for variety of business problems like customer churn prediction, next best action recommendation, segmentation, predictive failure, GDPR and regulatory reporting.
We are striving for the goals of growing both in the domestic and global markets, creating new business opportunities and reaching the desired level of success, which we will constantly search for.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Passionate for DevOps, and with the growing desire to make an impact and change our world for the better? At Greenbyte we fight climate change with code! And currently, we are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our Installations Services Team, in either Sweden (Gothenburg) or Spain (Seville).

About Greenbyte

Greenbyte is delivering an industry-leading SaaS (Software as a Service) application to owners and operators of renewable energy plants around the world. With our help, they produce more green energy and blow the competition out of the water!

Our cloud platform communicates in real-time with thousands of renewable energy assets around the world to collect their data, which is visualized in a modern cloud-based web system. As one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech companies, we're on a mission to push the renewable energy revolution forward and work closely together to accomplish great things.

About the Installation Services Team

As part of the Integration Services department, the Installations Team’s mission is to deliver a premium end-to-end integration experience to our customers. We are responsible for installing new renewable assets, such as wind or solar sites, onto the Greenbyte platform. Also, we take care of the operational environment for the installation process and data ingestion infrastructure.

We are made up of hard-working, fun-loving people who are passionate about making the world better. We are a very international team spread across multiple locations, with a team spirit that is truly hard to beat! We work with agile methodologies such as Kanban and Scrum.

What will you be doing?

Your primary focus will be to operate, support and improve Greenbyte’s data ingestion infrastructure. It today consists of 30+ AWS hosted Windows and Ubuntu servers, running a large variety of services and protocols, to receive and pre-process data from more than 70000+ renewable energy assets. Overall, you will help us to continue building a cloud-native, secure and scalable data ingestion infrastructure!

You will also form part of Greenbyte’s cross-departmental on-call team, responsible for handling critical incidents during out-of-office hours.

Finally, you will perform installations of renewable energy assets from time-to-time.

It goes without saying that you’ll get to know the renewable energy industry, are able to develop your skills further through internal and external learning events, and interact with our lovely customers.

Who are we looking for?


in working with:



 - System automation and Python development

In addition to this, we see it as an extra plus if you have experience with the following:

 - Network administration (StrongSwan, OpenVpn, etc.)
 - Industry protocols: OPC, Modbus, Ejabberd, IEC104, RestAPI’s etc.
 - Database Administration (MySQL, AWS Aurora)
 - IaC / Configuration management tools (AWS CDK, Ansible, etc.)

 - Infrastructure and Application monitoring (DataDog, etc.)

We are looking for a team member who is self-driven and has a strong sense of accountability. You enjoy working on both day-to-day operational activities and on long-term strategic topics and continuous improvements. You are always on the lookout for automation possibilities and have fun working in an international and agile environment.

Overall, we need fierce but humble people to help us achieve our ambitious plan. If you are all that and more, come join us!

Greenbyte is delivering a state-of-the-art SaaS (Software as a Service) application to owners and operators of wind and solar power plants around the world. With our help, they produce more green energy and blow the competition out of the water. Greenbyte is not only one of Sweden fastest growing tech companies, we are also a family, with all values that the wording entails. We work closely together to accomplish great things. We need fierce but humble people to help us achieve our ambitious plan. If you are all that and more, join us!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
We're looking for a passionate and driven DevOps Engineer to join our growing team in Växjö. This is a great opportunity to develop your software skills with modern technologies and gain invaluable experience in an industry-leading company. You will be working alongside talented colleagues and constantly learn new things. We put the bar high for ourselves cause we like the challenge and to always be up to date with the latest.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
At Plingot you will be working with industry-leading clients and focus on high-quality solutions. We are a team of top engineers with a passion to find smart solutions to complicated problems. Solving complex problems is what gets us up in the morning - we thrive in the challenge and don't shy away from raising the bar. We offer a workplace founded and driven by developers. A space in a creative and modern work environment, with stimulating tasks, great co-workers, and the possibility to take up big responsibilities.
THE ROLE
You will be working with long-term customer projects for global and industry-leading companies, in-house at Plingots headquarters in Växjö. We use cutting-edge technology and are very focused on delivering high-quality code. We measure output, not time spent.
You will:
maintain, monitor, and update our cloud infrastructure using modern tools such as Terraform, Helm, Kubernetes.
maintain our in-house CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure.
maintain, monitor, and update customers’ cloud infrastructure and/or give guidance on how to improve their stack.

WHO YOU ARE
You have a passion for programming, with strong attention to detail in order to deliver high-quality code. You are a creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills, and finding new innovative solutions makes you proud. You enjoy working in teams and value collaboration, but you are also able to work independently and deliver excellent results. You are self-going, responsible and have a natural way of communicating and collaborate with different people and teams.
Requirements

Git
Terraform
Kubernetes


Bonus points for experience with
AWS EC2 experience
Familiar with AWS VPC:s and routing tables

CircleCI or equivalent
Bash, Python, Ruby, Javascript - any type of scripting experience is a plus
Spoken and written Swedish

Up for an exciting challenge? Passion for writing good code? Fantastic! - Apply now and start YOUR adventure already today

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
We have built the first pipelines to production that can release with "1-click of a button" and now we need to expand our team of DevOps Engineers to scale up our automation. 
In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:

join the Automation team, where this position is placed, who is responsible for the delivery of infrastructure as code with emphasis on automated integration and delivery of platforms and services
Swedbank is in the middle of a large transformation where the bank quickly needs to adapt to fast-paced innovation and change in customer expectations. 
We are breaking new ground and need your help to bring our vision to reality!

What is needed in this role
Solid developer background with extensive experience in infrastructure as code, preferably using Ansible
Functional knowledge in continuous integration and continuous delivery

Experience with the command line and linux/unix based systems
Experience with git as version control system
Familiarity with applications running in Kubernetes clusters
Having security in mind
You will need to leverage a wide variety of skills and experience to tie many different types of tooling together
Curious of current trends within software development
Team player with an open mind and ready to help others


"Join our team and ...
be a part of an inspiring atmosphere with talented colleagues who like to share their knowledge and who are always ready to help. As your manager, I am including, caring and engaged. I like structure but can also be flexible and pragmatic. My objective is to create a positive and engaging work environment where the team can thrive and perform at its best. I believe that empowerment allows people to grow and do great things. If you find this inspiring - this is the role for you!" Jon Siljehag, your future leader
We look forward to receiving your application by 05.01.2021.
Location: Sundbyberg, Sweden
Contacts



We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.
Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.


Öppen för alla
Vi fokuserar 100% på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

Vi är partner med AWS, Microsoft, Google och Red Hat och behöver stärka vårt team ytterligare inför framtida gemensamma satsningar. Därmed finns det en stor spelplan för Dig att vara med att spela på om du vill.

description.text:

Hos oss är det ena projektet inte det andra likt. Just nu söker vi efter erfarna DevOps Engineers. Vi har uppdrag för flera stora och mindre kunder i alla delar av Stockholm. headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Om Nordax
Vi är en bank. Lika trygga och pålitliga, men mer framåtlutade och snabbfotade med en företagskultur som präglas av samarbete, engagemang och ett stort hjärta för uppgiften! Sedan starten 2003 har Nordax haft en stark tillväxt och utveckling. Tillsammans är vi cirka 280 medarbetare från Sverige, Norge, Finland och Tyskland som alla sitter samlade på vårt kontor i Stockholms innerstad.

Om rollen
Du kommer att vara en del av vårt IT-team som bygger och driver Nordax hjärta.
Som medlem i plattformsteamet under IT-avdelningens utvecklingsenhet kommer du att vara ansvarig för att bygga en ännu modernare DevOps-infrastruktur. Du låter dig lysa med dina innovativa lösningar medan du arbetar i ett team. Du kommer att rapportera till Team Manager Björn Sohlén.

Nyckelområden:
 utforma, vidareutveckla och vårda befintliga och helt nya DevOps-plattformar
 implementering av nya CI / CD-lösningar genom modern teknik som Kubernetes

Vem vi tror att du är
Vi söker dig med stort eget driv som kan arbeta självständigt och är en problemlösare ut i fingerspetsarna - både i praktiken och i teorin.
Vidare är du en kommunikativ lagspelare som tillsammans med våra team och andra stakeholders tar fram riktningen och driver igenom det vi ser framför oss.

För att du ska ha de bästa förutsättningarna att axla rollen som DevOps-engineer ser att du behärskar engelska i tal och skrift och självklart att du har erfarenhet av👇🏼:


 CI / CD-pipelines (t ex Jenkins, Azure Devops, CircleCI, Octopus eller liknande verktyg)
 Container Orchestration (t ex Kubernetes, Docker Swarm eller Nomad)
 Erfarenhet av objektorienterade språk (C # eller Java)
 Configuration management (t ex Ansible eller Puppet)

Utöver ovanstående blir vi väldigt glada om du dessutom bockar av något av dessa meriterande kunskaper:

 Windows Server
 Azure Devops
 Octopus Deploy
 Git
 Programmering i .Net Core
 Programmering i React eller NextJS
 Service Mesh (t ex Istio eller Linkerd)
 Arbete med en av de stora molnleverantörerna (t ex  Google Cloud, AWS, Azure)
programmering med .NET
 IT-säkerhet
 Arbete med övervaknings- och loggningslösningar
 Rollen som systemadministratör eller motsvarande
 Arbete inom finansbranschen


Vad händer nu?
Vi går löpande igenom ansökningar så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!
Vi tror på forskningsbaserade och objektiva utvärderingsmetoder som stöd i arbetet att hitta rätt person till rätt roll. 


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

headline: DevOps engineer
description.text:
Softhouse cloud team växer och vi letar nu efter en  Senior DevOps engineer till vårt kontor i Stockholm.

På Softhouse är vi över 200 teknikexperter med uppgiften att utveckla mjukvara, affärer och människor. Då vi befinner oss i en bransch där kompetensutveckling är avgörande för oss att för att alltid ligga i framkant, är vi måna om att alla får möjlighet att utvecklas både kompetensmässigt och som person. Vår organisation är platt och egna initiativ, idéer och tankar värdesätts.

Vi befinner oss  i en spännande fas där vi utvecklar vårt molnerbjudande. Vi ser ett växande behov att hjälpa våra kunder att utveckla produkter och tjänster där kombinationen av kunskaper inom mjukvaruutveckling och infrastruktur är väldigt efterfrågat. Det innebär att du kommer få möjlighet att både skriva kod men även  implementera och drifta system för CI/CD och automatisering samt arbeta med monitorering, övervakning och mätning av tillhörande plattformar i molnet. 

Om tjänsten

Vi söker dig med god erfarenhet av utveckling på plattformar som AWS, Azure eller GCP för DevOps-roller till vårt Stockholmskontor. Din tjänst är lokal, men du kommer ingå i ett virtuellt nationellt team med remote-leverans över hela Sverige.

Hos oss får du möjlighet att påverka vårt sätt att jobba med utveckling i molnet, både internt och gentemot våra kunder, genom utbildning och kunskapshöjande aktiviteter men även genom att påverka arbetsprocess och affärsområde. Vi ger dig både frihet att forma rollen och stöd samt verktygen du kan behöva på vägen!

Några exempel på arbetsuppgifter som ingår i din roll:

- Föra proaktiva diskussioner kring molnlösningar med våra kunders ledningsgrupper och andra intressenter
- Arbeta utvecklings- och behovsstyrt för att kunna leverera bästa möjliga tjänst till våra kunder
- Arbeta med dina kollegor i virtuella team för att förstå kundbehov och hitta rätt lösning
- Ansvara att hjälpa kunden med att ta fram nya arbetssätt som kopplar in DevOps-tänk med befintligt arbetssätt och verktyg
- Sätta upp upp och drifta CI/CD-pipelines med testning, byggprocess och artefakt-hantering
- Effektivisera tjänster, utvecklingsprocess och infrastruktur samt leda och medverka i både interna och externa projekt
- Rådgiva och utbilda kring dina specialistområden för kunder och kollegor


Din profil

För att lyckas i den här rollen tror vi att du har god erfarenhet av utveckling och infrastruktur och att du tar initiativ att lära dig nya kunskaper och tekniker. Detta innebär att du bör ha erfarenhet av att ta ägarskap i projekt från början till slut, och hitta kreativa lösningar som uppfyller kundens behov. Då du kommer vara en fundamental del av Cloud-teamet är det också viktigt att du håller dig uppdaterad på trender då produkter och tjänster inom molnteknik utvecklas i hög takt. Rollen innebär även en stor portion kunskapsutbyte för att stärka dina kollegor i teamet, men även för att smidigt kunna ta till dig nya kunskaper och färdigheter.

För den här rollen behöver du ha teknisk kunskap och erfarenhet inom:

- språk som Java, Python, Node.js eller .Net och C#



Vi önskar också att du har god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska; både skriftligt och muntligt.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

headline: Devops Engineer
description.text:
Who are we?
Volvo Cars is a company on a mission; to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable and smart future.
Since 1927, we have been a brand known for our commitment to safety, creating innovative cars that make life less complicated for our consumers. In 2010, we decided to transform our business, resulting in a totally new generation of cars and technologies, as well as steady growth and record sales. 
We are constantly pushing our own skills and abilities to drive change in the automobile industry like never before. We are looking for innovative, committed people to join us in this endeavour and create safe, sustainable and connected cars. We believe in the power of people and will challenge and support you to reach your full potential. Join us and be part of Volvo Cars’ journey into the future.

What’s in it for you?
This role is within our Global Online Digital team, which is using digital technologies to reinvent the experience of becoming a Volvo customer. There is no reason the experience of buying a car should be painful and difficult – it should be as enjoyable and exciting as actually having a new car. That is our mission. You will be working in a small team of DevOps engineers where there are shared responsibilities, but also areas where you will the main owner of a specific problem. You will be working in, or in close collaboration with our various product teams with Developers, Quality assurance engineers etc.
You should have start-up experience where you have quickly developed prototypes and catalysed product development in a fast paced, fluid environment. You are a hands-on developer with front-end experience. You are experienced with agile development and a champion of software development best practices. As we are working in a global organization it's important that you are able to cooperate with people from many different cultures, that you are able to work independently based on mutual goals and are both willing and able to share your knowledge with others directly or indirectly through written media.
You need to be Fluent in English.

You and your skills
Experience of programming, testing and operational management of IT  systems and networks.
Hands on production experience with container orchestration (K8s - AKS,EKS) and containerization technology  (e.g. Docker) is must.
Experience in deploying Micro service Architecture, Applications, and supporting services as well as implementing and managing Devops CI/CD pipeline.
Experience in infrastructure automation using e.g. Terraform.
Exposure on serverless architecture. Interest and ability in solving problems related to these areas.
You have experience of the most commonly used programming and scripting languages, e.g. Python, Java, C#, Javascript, PowerShell etc. and Agile methodologies.
Interest in internet and application security as well as  experience in cloud-based solutions and management, in particular AWS and Azure.
Knowledge in defining and ensure implementations of Devops and Gitops related processes as well as experience in implementation and maintenance of distrubuted monitoring, tracing and logging infrastructure. (for example ELK, Prometheus, Grafana, Jaegar).
We want your application at the latest 27th of December 2020. Please note that applications via email will not be accepted due to GDPR. We are looking forward to your application!

headline: DevOps Ingenjör
description.text:
Vi söker DevOps ingenjör till vår sektion "Software Continuous Integration and Configuration Managment"



Din roll

Vi arbetar kontinuerligt med att förbättra vår utvecklingsmiljö samt vårt bygg och integrationsflöde. För att förstärka och snabba upp det arbetet behöver vår sektion förstärkas med ytterliggare utvecklare med erfarenhet av Continuous Integration och Configuration Management.


Du kommer att vara en del i ett av teamen som har det operativa ansvaret att möjliggöra för utvecklingsteamen att bygga, integrera, leverera och konfigurationshantera vårt avioniksystem.


Alla medlemmar uppmuntras och förväntas bidra till teamets gemensamma uppgift, utifrån sin egen kompetens och erfarenhet. Teamen består av både juniora och seniora utvecklare.



Din profil

Du har teknisk högskoleutbildning samt ett intresse för programmering och kompetens inom några av följande områden:

 * Continuous Integration/Deployment

 * Versionshanteringssystem (t.ex. Git och ClearCase)
 * Mjukvarutestning


 * Byggsystem

 * Make
 * Python
 * Artifactory
 * Configuration Management
 * Virtualisering/containers (t.ex. VMware och Docker)


Du gillar att jobba i tvärfunktionella team och att bidra till både teamets samt verksamhetens utveckling. Det är viktigt för dig att komma framåt och att kunna hitta effektiva lösningar. Du är en engagerad och kreativ person som vill utvecklas både personligt och professionellt samt prova olika teknikområden.



Vad du blir en del av

Aeronautics, ett affärsområde inom Saab, erbjuder flygrelaterade delsystem, obemannade flygsystem, flygplansstruktur och service till försvarskunder och civil flygindustri över hela världen. Aeronautics ansvarar också för utveckling, produktion, marknadsföring, försäljning och support av Gripensystemet.


Området Avionics Architecture, Integration and Delivery ansvarar för utveckling av flygplanets grundplattform (datorarkitektur, mjukvaruarkitektur, implementation av lågnivå- och säkerhetskritisk mjukvara). Vi har även ansvar för utvecklingsprocess och metodik inom mjukvaruutveckling. Vår verksamhet lägger grunden för hela den övriga funktionsutvecklingen inom Gripen E/F projektet.


Du kommer att ingå i sektionen Software Continuous Integration and Configuration Management som är en del av området Avionic Architecture, Integration and Delivery.

Sektionen ansvarar framförallt för bygg, integration och konfigurationshantering av mjukvara för Avionic Core Computer System i Gripen E men vi arbetar även med att förbättra vår verktygs och utvecklingsmiljö. Som en del av vårt ansvar stöder vi även utvecklingsorganisationen i Brasilien med leveranser av programvara och verktyg.




Tjänsterna innebär arbete som omfattas av försvarssekretess och krav på svenskt medborgarskap.

headline: Devops Linux
description.text:
We’re here to connect you to what matters most, and by doing so, empowering societies. As a Telenor employee, you will be part of a large, international organization that goes beyond customers – we want to play an important role in the societies we serve. Being connected can change your life, and we’re serious about helping our services make the widest possible impact.

We are looking for an driven and collaborative person to join our TV team. Telenor is rapidly heading towards a digital and data driven future and we are looking for people with a natural proactive drive who wish to make a difference.

What you´ll do
TV services is changing rapidly, and streaming and other services are more integrated with each other. People have changed their ways of consuming TV and Telenor is taking the next step in the future TV-services. We are looking for a person who wants to be a part of this exiting journey that we are in! As a Technical System Specialist, you will work in a challenging environment and with a close dialogue with different partners within our organization. Your role is to define and communicate requirements as well as technical possibilities and limitations.


     * Act as subject matter expert in projects that involves the TV platforms or services
     * Be the expert in develop and integrate legacy services with other systems
     * Contribute as a member of the DEVOPS group TV-services within Networks
     * Participate in RFQ processes and provide technical recommendations and vendor selection support
     * Supervise that the TV platforms and integration is according to IT security internal regulations

Who are you
You are a team player and are used to act on your own initiative and takes responsibility for the outcome. You have the ability to quickly analyze complex questions and present new and inventive ideas and solutions. You are communicative and communicates clearly verbally as well as in writing (Swedish and English).
     * Competence within following:
          + Expert knowledge in RHEL and Mysql
          + Terminal OS like Android, IOS and TVOS
          + Streaming platform design and function, Varnish etc.
          + Subsystems like Splunk
          + Experience in BSS integration projects

Our promise

We promise you a human company eager to learn and rapidly adapt to a digital reality. You will be welcomed into a skilled team of professional and knowledgeable colleagues. In addition, you will get:
     * A flexible way of work - have a lunch workout without having to rush back, leave/pick up the kids from school? This is no problem if you make sure your team is happy and you deliver your work
     * A generous health and benefit package with wellness grant, health insurance, ”give me a break”-days, employee discounts, regular health checks, occupational pension and much more
     * Development programs to deepen your knowledge and broaden the competence.

Come join us

Don’t send your CV by mail – these will not be evaluated.


     * According to Telenor's policy, we conduct background checks on the final candidate for all recruitments
     * Application deadline: We evaluate candidates continuously so please apply today
     * Location: Solna, Stockholm

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Kambi is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services for online and retail gambling operators. Our mission is to create the world’s leading sports betting experience, from front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling. 



Have you been through a change involving container architecture infrastructure and you know that it is more than just technology shift?

As part of our strategy to continuously improve our way of working, we are building a new Engineering Experience team to help us provide the best possible experience for our developers. You will have the opportunity to influence the culture of the Development organization, facilitate technical delivery and work with the team´s strategy definition and implementation.

What you will do:

• Your main responsibility will be to provide stable and reliable infrastructure baselines for the development teams in collaboration with IT Operations
• You will support the Development teams to grow and deliver healthy software, by facilitating tools and process alignment
• You will interact with distributed development teams across several locations

You'd like to work with these technologies:

• Container architecture infrastructure (e.g. Kubernetes)
• Test and release framework and tools
• Virtualization environments

• Networking and Automation
• Globally hosted servers and network equipment

We expect you to:

• Be curious, self-driven, team player, pragmatic and persistent
• Enjoy working in a self-organizing, self-managing team
• Have experience with test/release infrastructure
• Have demonstrated experience with agile development software release

• Be comfortable with technologies like load balancing, routing, firewalls, VPNs, monitoring and virtualization

What’s in it for you?

• Opportunity to work in a successful and fast-growing company
• A fun and flexible working culture
• Work with smart and humble people
• International work environment

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Vi söker en DevOps Engineer till ett agilt webbteam som arbetar med Continuous Delivery, automatiserad testning och automatiserad konfigurationshantering. De har som ambition att automatisera sitt arbete redan från början för att undvika att behöva göra samma sak mer än en gång. Allt i linje med DevOps.

I din roll som DevOps Engineer / Systemadministratör kommer du att ingå i ett agilt och tvärfunktionellt webbutvecklingsteam tillsammans med utvecklare, testare, m.fl. I teamet kommer du att vara en central person och underlätta dina kollegors dagliga arbete genom att diskutera idéer, angreppsätt och lösningar. Du får många kunniga kollegor som gärna delar med sig av sin kunskap och erfarenheter och de jobbar aktivt med kompetensspridning.

Applikationen bygger på Linux, java, mikrotjänster och containers. De utvecklar ständigt sina arbetssätt och försöker ta till sig av den senaste tekniken. Just nu jobbar de bl.a. med att migrera sina mikrotjänster från Docker till Kubernetes.

I dina dagliga arbetsuppgifter ingår att delta proaktivt i utvecklingsarbetet för att säkerställa en stabil driftsmiljö och effektiv Continuous Delivery pipeline. Vidare kommer du att övervaka, felsöka och utföra installationer, samt ansvara för konfiguration och integration mot bakomliggande system.

Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden

- [ITEM]

Viktiga avgränsningar

Måste kunna börja den [DATUM].

Nödvändiga färdigheter, kunskaper och erfarenheter

- Flytande svenska i tal och skrift
- Goda kunskaper i engelska i tal och skrift
- Minst 5 års praktisk erfarenhet av systemadministration i en Linuxbaserad produktionsmiljö
- God/Mycket kunskap samt praktisk erfarenhet av scriptprogrammering i linuxmiljöer i Bash, Python
- Minst 2 års erfarenhet att jobba i stora och komplexa microtjänstmiljöer i Docker, Kubernetes eller liknande i produktionsmiljö
- Minst 2 års praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med konfigurationshantering (gärna Puppet) i produktionsmiljö
- Minst 2 års praktisk erfarenhet av GIT för versionshantering
- Minst 1 års praktisk erfarenhet av att konfigurera/utveckla pipelines för CI/CD
- Minst 1 års praktisk erfarenhet av att jobba i ett agilt applikationsutvecklingsteam


Kvalificerande färdigheter, kunskaper och erfarenheter

- Praktisk erfarenhet av att utveckla eller administrera en stor webbplats
- Praktisk erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling med ex Java
- Praktisk erfarenhet av automatiserad testning med ex Java
- Praktisk erfarenhet av kodbaserad felsökning i Java

- Praktisk erfarenhet av GoCD

- Praktisk erfarenhet av BIG-IP
- Praktisk erfarenhet av Nagios / Check_mk
- Praktisk erfarenhet av Elastic Stack (Elastic, Logstash, Kibana)
- Praktisk erfarenhet av Grafana
- Praktisk erfarenhet av Maven
- Praktisk erfarenhet av Spring/Spring-boot


Personliga egenskaper

- Flexibel och kunna balansera mellan interna och kunds intresse
- Driven
- Ansvarstagande
- God analytisk och problemlösande förmåga
- Kommunikativ och samarbetsinriktad


Ytterligare information

Start: ASAP

Arbetsbelastning: 100%

Lön: Beroende på erfarenhet.

Hur du ansöker

Vi får ett stort antal ansökningar. För att göra det möjligt för oss att göra en rättvis bedömning är det viktigt att du ägnar lite tid åt att skapa en bra motivering till hur du kommer att lyckas i rollen och varför vi ska välja dig.

Koppla ditt svar till de specifika kraven i arbetsbeskrivningen, hänvisa till dina tidigare uppdrag, anställningar, utbildning och personliga egenskaper och förklara hur de kommer att bidra till hur du kommer att lyckas i rollen.

Ansök med ett flersidigt, tydligt CV på svenska, helst i Word-format. CVn där varje tidigare anställning och projekt uppdrag beskrivs i form av mini-fallstudier gör din kompetens tydligare för oss. Se till att alla relevanta färdigheter som efterfrågas i beskrivningen nämns i ditt CV i anslutning till varje relevant projekt eller uppdrag där du har använt dem.

På grund av antalet mottagna ansökningar kan vi inte lämna individuell feedback.

Du måste vara svensk, Nordisk, EU, EES eller Schengen-medborgare eller på annat sätt ha rätt att arbeta för valfri arbetsgivare i Sverige.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 325 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.



In 2018, iZettle became part of the PayPal family. iZettle is on a mission to help small businesses succeed in a world of giants. Tens of millions of small businesses worldwide are still being underserved by the traditional players. By giving small businesses the tools to get paid, sell smarter and grow, we’re empowering them to reach their full potential. Together with PayPal, we can reach 24 million merchants across the world with more of the affordable tools they need to thrive. Join us in putting an end to the ordinary way the world defines financial freedom.
As we continue on our quest to democratise financial services, we are now looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to join our Runtime Team. In this role, you will get the opportunity to join a group of passionate people responsible for the day-to-day operations of our CI/CD systems, runtime environments and processes that allow millions of transactions to flow through our system every day. If this brief intro already sounds interesting to you, feel free to scroll down and read on for more info.


A glimpse of what you would get here
As part of the Platforms Alliance at iZettle, our core mission consists in providing a first class CI/CD and runtime environment for our development Teams, enabling them to iterate releases quickly and safely across our environments. In practice, we fulfil this mission by implementing tools and processes that help iZettle move faster than ever before. We use these CI/CD systems for every type of service such as Backend, Mobile and Front-end to the different runtime environments we support.
On top of that, we are in charge of the runtime systems we support which are currently AWS ECS and Kubernetes, so that would also be part of your shared responsibilities. These runtime systems support the distributed microservices backends that run all of our products and are under continuous improvement to make workflows faster and safer for the developers we support.


Last but not least, as a member of the wider platform area you will be able to make a difference in a more general direction around shared DevOps domains between the platform teams such as infrastructure and monitoring, and collaborate on POC work as well as larger projects.


A few things to know about our Team
We are a remote focused Team with members sitting in Stockholm and Edinburgh and we collaborate closely with our Operations as well as various Teams across the organisation to deliver on common objectives. Our values as a team are collaboration, learning together and openness. In this spirit, we use tools such as pairing sessions and non formal calls to facilitate these values and allow everyone to be heard and contribute to the mission.



A solid expertise in CI/CD systems;
Some programming background (Python, Golang or Bash);
A passion to automate away repetitive tasks and increase efficiency;
A good experience with Docker;
Great collaboration skills.

​
You will earn extra points if you...

Worked with PCI-DSS compliant infrastructures;


Comfortable with CircleCi, Concourse CI or Jenkins.



Sounds like you? 
If yes, let's take things further... We’d love to hear from you so go on, hit apply and let's talk!


Small minds never helped small businesses
It takes originality and an open mind to start a small business. That’s why small minds have no place in ours. At iZettle, we celebrate the individuality of the people we work with, valuing the impact that diverse experiences, backgrounds, perspectives and ideas can have on our culture and the products we build. We’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer, a place where everyone can benefit from equal access to professional development and bring their whole personality to work.


We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.


﻿PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

headline: Devops Engineer
description.text:
Devops Engineer

What happens when you combine Developer Operations with Special Operations? You get a DevOps at Specops! 

Position summary

As a DevOps engineer at Specops, you will work as part of a small, autonomous team deploying, securing, and troubleshooting in a continuous delivery environment, with a continuous improvement mindset. You will play an integral part of the Specops R&D department, managing the 24×7 offering of various authentication solutions in the cloud. You will work with a global team of developers, quality assurance testers, product services, support, and, of course, DevOps engineers.

Responsibilities

- Deploy, support, and manage new releases
- Automate and improve the Specops continuous delivery process
- Research and implement new tools and technologies
- Improve automated test suites
- Ensure uptime and customer satisfaction
- Implement security configurations
- Coordinate penetration tests
- Monitor and improve performance

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related technical field. Equivalent practical experience is also accepted.

Required experience

- 3+ years working as a software developer in a CI/CD and DevOps environment
- Experience with high load, high security business critical systems
- Real-life Azure and/or AWS experience
- Designing and automating workflows and processes

Required skills

- 3+ years of experience writing code, preferably using C# .NET

- Continuous delivery
- Automation
- Server/application monitoring/logging
- Databases in general, and Microsoft SQL Server specifically


About Specops Software

Specops Software is an award-winning software company that develops solutions for desktop and password management which extend the functionality of Windows infrastructure. With offices in the US, Canada, the UK and headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden, Specops Software helps companies, organizations and educational institutions in more than 50 countries. Specops Software has grown steadily since it was founded in 2001 and reports strong turnover and solid profit.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Cambio is a market-leading supplier with a comprehensive offering for the entire healthcare and care chain. We are growing continuously and now have about 700 employees in several countries. 



As a DevOps engineer, you will be a part of a team that supports the DevOps transformation of Cambio. You will be working with developing frameworks and tools to improve our delivery pipeline. As a team, we are on a journey not only to modernize and transform our development infrastructure but also to transform our development culture. 

At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.

About you

You are dedicated to optimizing and simplify our delivery pipeline and the underlying infrastructure in close collaboration with the rest of the organization. As a DevOps engineer you have an eye for solving the problems at the right place. As a person, you are analytical, humble and enjoy taking responsibility. In our team, we like new technology, so we hope your share that passion with us. We also expect you to have:

- Expertise in software development infrastructure services such as Bitbucket, Sonarqube, Artifactory and Grafana.
- Experience on automated deployment and configuration of infrastructure using tools such as Packer, Ansible, Terraform, Puppet and Chef.
- Knowledge on Docker orchestration with products like Kubernetes or Openshift.

- Tool writing skills using Groovy, Python or similar.
- Knowledge within software configuration management.
- Experience in coaching and teaching others in your area of expertise.
- Experience working with build systems like Gradle, NPM.
- Understanding of software development, preferably with experience as a software developer.
- Git knowledge and related tooling.


Place of employment: Linköping

Scope: Full time

We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.

We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who has the legal right to work in Sweden. We will ask for verification during the process.

We look forward to receiving your application!

description.text:
Description
We develop a cloud communication platform that’s already used by 8 out of 10 leading tech giants in the US, with over 40 billion transactions every year. A platform which can reach virtually every mobile phone on the planet in seconds or less? We are looking to add a DevOps Engineer to join our team in Malmö.



In the role as a DevOps Engineer at Sinch you will work in a team of five people together with our engineering teams to design, build and maintain our infrastructure, develop the delivery pipeline and monitoring capabilities as well as the various tools we use to operate our technical platform. You will work in an agile environment with a strong focus on automation, reliability and continuous improvement. This role involves a lot of responsibility in designing and taking our technical platform to the next level.
As our new DevOps Engineer you will:
Define and implement modern containerization and cloud solutions
Developing and improving our CI/CD pipelines
Work close to the developers and operations in designing systems that are secure and highly scalable with fast deliveries to production
Working with all teams to ensure that our services are always up and running smoothly
Make the lives of our developers easier!



Who are you?
For this role we imagine that you have a few years of previous experience within SRE or DevOps. As a person, you have a proactive and quality-oriented mindset, are eager to learn and have a strong drive to constantly improve things. You enjoy working in a cooperative and cross-functional environment and are generous in providing support and sharing knowledge with your colleagues.
In order to contribute in this role we believe you are good at:
Optimizing existing systems for scalability and building large-scale infrastructure
Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS EKS) and cloud platforms (AWS)
Building and improving CI/CD pipelines in Gitlab
Infrastructure as Code with tools such as Terraform, Ansible, Puppet


Join us on our journey!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Passionate for DevOps, and with the growing desire to make an impact and change our world for the better? At Greenbyte we fight climate change with code! And currently, we are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our Installations Services Team, in either Sweden (Gothenburg) or Spain (Seville).

About Greenbyte

Greenbyte is delivering an industry-leading SaaS (Software as a Service) application to owners and operators of renewable energy plants around the world. With our help, they produce more green energy and blow the competition out of the water!

Our cloud platform communicates in real-time with thousands of renewable energy assets around the world to collect their data, which is visualized in a modern cloud-based web system. As one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech companies, we're on a mission to push the renewable energy revolution forward and work closely together to accomplish great things.

About the Installation Services Team

As part of the Integration Services department, the Installations Team’s mission is to deliver a premium end-to-end integration experience to our customers. We are responsible for installing new renewable assets, such as wind or solar sites, onto the Greenbyte platform. Also, we take care of the operational environment for the installation process and data ingestion infrastructure.

We are made up of hard-working, fun-loving people who are passionate about making the world better. We are a very international team spread across multiple locations, with a team spirit that is truly hard to beat! We work with agile methodologies such as Kanban and Scrum.

What will you be doing?

Your primary focus will be to operate, support and improve Greenbyte’s data ingestion infrastructure. It today consists of 30+ AWS hosted Windows and Ubuntu servers, running a large variety of services and protocols, to receive and pre-process data from more than 70000+ renewable energy assets. Overall, you will help us to continue building a cloud-native, secure and scalable data ingestion infrastructure!

You will also form part of Greenbyte’s cross-departmental on-call team, responsible for handling critical incidents during out-of-office hours.

Finally, you will perform installations of renewable energy assets from time-to-time.

It goes without saying that you’ll get to know the renewable energy industry, are able to develop your skills further through internal and external learning events, and interact with our lovely customers.

Who are we looking for?


in working with:



 - System automation and Python development

In addition to this, we see it as an extra plus if you have experience with the following:

 - Network administration (StrongSwan, OpenVpn, etc.)
 - Industry protocols: OPC, Modbus, Ejabberd, IEC104, RestAPI’s etc.
 - Database Administration (MySQL, AWS Aurora)
 - IaC / Configuration management tools (AWS CDK, Ansible, etc.)

 - Infrastructure and Application monitoring (DataDog, etc.)

We are looking for a team member who is self-driven and has a strong sense of accountability. You enjoy working on both day-to-day operational activities and on long-term strategic topics and continuous improvements. You are always on the lookout for automation possibilities and have fun working in an international and agile environment.

Overall, we need fierce but humble people to help us achieve our ambitious plan. If you are all that and more, come join us!

Greenbyte is delivering a state-of-the-art SaaS (Software as a Service) application to owners and operators of wind and solar power plants around the world. With our help, they produce more green energy and blow the competition out of the water. Greenbyte is not only one of Sweden fastest growing tech companies, we are also a family, with all values that the wording entails. We work closely together to accomplish great things. We need fierce but humble people to help us achieve our ambitious plan. If you are all that and more, join us!

headline: DevOps lead
description.text:
About DigitalRoute

DigitalRoute has the only platform that is purpose built to convert raw usage data into billable items. This enables companies to capitalize on the growing wave of usage-based business models. More than 400 companies rely on our platform for usage-based monetization, quote-to-cash automation, finance system consolidation and telecom mediation. We deliver extreme precision in the most complex environments in the world. We’re the new standard for usage-based revenue.

We are a profitable, global company of 250 employees. With our headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden, we have offices around the globe, from Kuala Lumpur to Atlanta.

It is highly probable that at some point in time your data has passed through technology from DigitalRoute. If you turn on the heating in your house, travel by airplane, buy a train ticket or make a call with your phone from anywhere in the world there is a great chance that the company behind these services use our technology to work with their data. You may not know about us, but the companies you trust to provide these daily services certainly do. 

We are looking for a DevOps Lead to join DigitalRoute's development leadership team and help us to 1) ramp up DevOps and continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) practice across our development teams (Sweden, Malaysia and Bulgaria), all operating in an agile (Scrum) fashion and 2) ensure it is running and working. It is a unique opportunity to shape and define how we release our mission-critical software to some of the largest brands around the world, Coca-Cola, Volvo, VMware and Verizon to state a few.

As the DevOps lead you will:

• Drive the adoption and implementation of DevOps practices throughout our development organization, more specifically for our SaaS product (Usage Data Platform), acting as a coach, subject matter expert and process owner
• Identify, evaluate and implement tools needed to implement the processes as well as ensure complete transparency and up-to-the-minute information on the status of releases pushed to the cloud
• Be responsible for the overall delivery pipeline of our SaaS product, from inception (Product Management) to operations (SRE)
• Be the interface between Product Management, Development and SREs during the release planning and roadmap definition processes
• Work very closely with the Quality team to devise strategies to increase quality and test automation.
• Be a key stakeholder of our support and maintenance policies: SLIs, SLOs, SLAs, deprecation, support schedule, etc.
• Be forward-looking and monitor industry trends and practices to ensure our release process remains current and can support new development trends
• Be a key member of DigitalRoute's ProdTech leadership team



• Collaborative - yet able to bring distributed teams to closure
• Transparent and direct communicator
• Goal-oriented and can-do attitude
• Highly organized, analytical
• Technically-curious and always eager to learn
• Hands-on and with enough successful experience (or scars!) to ensure your advice carries weight

In addition, the following experience would be required:

• Minimum of 3 years in a release management or development position in an organization that has embraced DevOps, agile and continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD)

• Familiarity with modern development and release management tools such as Jira, Bitbucket, Github, Jenkins, Artifactory, DockerHub, Amazon ECR.

Our offering

ELITS can offer you varying and challenging job as a consultant with great development opportunities. We have interesting, long-term assignments where you can develop and work closely with colleagues who share your passion for technology and delivering Another kind of IT.

As an employee of ELITS, you get a number of benefits such as:

- Extremely competent and skilled colleagues

As an employee at ELITS, you get to enjoy the best of both worlds; partly the customer environments, but also ELITS as an employer where you are involved in shaping our great company culture and share knowledge and experiences with other like-minded people. You will also be able to knowledge exchange with your colleagues, you will also be offered training, skills development and certifications together with our tech-partners.

Our consultant assignments often includes tasks such as managing, establishing and maintaining DevOps infrastructures. Working close to development teams and implementing new technologies. Developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines and tools to accelerate and optimize our and our customers services and deliveries.

In the role as consultant at ELITS, there are great development opportunities for those who are passionate about technology, DevOps and opensource!

In that case - send your application to us today!

If you have questions about the role or our assignments, do not hesitate to get in touch in the way that suits you best, chat, email or phone!

headline: DevOps Engineers
description.text:
Our offering

ELITS can offer you varying and challenging job as a consultant with great development opportunities. We have interesting, long-term assignments where you can develop and work closely with colleagues who share your passion for technology and delivering Another kind of IT.

As an employee of ELITS, you get a number of benefits such as:

- Extremely competent and skilled colleagues
- Wellness allowance
- Private health insurance
- Private pension advisory
- Benefit portal
- Individually adapted development and training plan
- Opportunity for co-ownership and profit sharing


About the role:

For long-term consulting assignments with our customers, we are now looking for several DevOps Engineers to be part of our skilled and fast growing Devops-team!

As an employee at ELITS, you get to enjoy the best of both worlds; partly the customer environments, but also ELITS as an employer where you are involved in shaping our great company culture and share knowledge and experiences with other like-minded people. You will also be able to knowledge exchange with your colleagues, you will also be offered training, skills development and certifications together with our tech-partners.

Our consultant assignments often includes tasks such as managing, establishing and maintaining DevOps infrastructures. Working close to development teams and implementing new technologies. Developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines and tools to accelerate and optimize our and our customers services and deliveries.

In the role as consultant at ELITS, there are great development opportunities for those who are passionate about technology, DevOps and opensource!



We expect you to:

- Experience of System Administration in a Linux-based production environment
- Have a couple of years’ experience working within DevOps
- Experience working with Container infrastructure (Docker, Kubernetes)
- Experience with reporting and monitoring tools such as Grafana, Prometheus, elastic search

- Experience with source control management such as  SVN or Git.
- Experience in Programming/scripting languages such as Bash, Python,
- Ability to work well both independently and in diverse teams.



In that case - send your application to us today!



For this position, background checks are also carried out by the final candidate.

If you have questions about the role or our assignments, do not hesitate to get in touch in the way that suits you best, chat, email or phone!

headline: DevOps specialist
description.text:
We are seeking a DevOps specialist for a customer project in Stockholm. This role will be remote working.



- Managing, establishing and maintaining DevOps infrastructures.
- Working with the development teams and implementing new technologies.
- Responsible for developing and maintaining our CI/CD pipelines, and tools to accelerate and optimize the delivery.


Essential (must have) skills, knowledge and experience


- 3+ years’ experience in DevOps and/or development teams
- Highly motivated, a responsible, passionate, self-learner individual with great interpersonal skills
- Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple work assignments simultaneously
- Extensive knowledge of software architecture, networking, and monitoring production systems
- Working experience with deployment technologies as K8s, docker, chef & puppet
- Solid understanding modern software stacks as micro-services, no-sql DBs
- Extensive knowledge with virtualization technologies as KVM, VMWare, OpenStack etc
- Experience in building CI/CD pipelines from git to deployable artifacts
- Programming skills, scripting languages & build tools - Bash, Python, PowerShell, Groovy, MSBuild, Ant, Maven
- Ability to work well both independently and in diverse teams


Personal attributes

- Flexible and able to balance between internal and customer interests

Additional information

Start: ASAP

Duration: 3-6 months with option for extension

Workload: 100%

Salary: Dependent on experience

We also accept sub-contractors for this role. In such case please state your all-inclusive rate when applying.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Before you apply

We want to be able to make a fair assessment and it is therefore important that you create a good statement on a few sentences about how you will succeed in the role and why we should choose you.

Preferably write a short description of how you meet each of the specific requirements in the job description. Refer to previous assignments and employments, education and personal qualities.

We prefer detailed CVs in Word or Pages format with plenty of information and details. Avoid PDFs because in many cases they are not fully searchable. Describe relevant previous projects and assignments in detail, what the task was, what the team was, how you solved it and what tools you used.

Due to the number of applications received, we are unable to provide individual feedback.

You must be a Swedish, Nordic, EU, EEA or Swiss citizen or otherwise have a right to work in Sweden.
